snippet: Shares have dropped 20 percent since their September peak. Some investors may be selling in anticipation of higher capital gains taxes.
abstract: Apple's shares fall 3.8 percent, and have dropped 20 percent since their September peak; some investors may be selling in anticipation of higher capital gains taxes and uncertainty over demand for types of products company sells.
lead_paragraph: Shares have dropped 20 percent since their September peak. Some investors may be selling in anticipation of higher capital gains taxes.

headline.seo: Apple Stock Sinks as Profits and Products Are Questioned
headline.main: Product Questions and Threats of Higher Tax Hit Apple Shares
headline.print_headline: Product Questions and Threats Of Higher Tax Hit Apple Shares
